sect1.title: Mounting $LFS/proc file system
sect1.para: In order for certain programs to function properly, the proc file system must be mounted and available from within the chroot'ed environment as well. It's not a problem to mount the proc file system (or any other file system for that matter) twice or even more than that.
The proc file system is mounted under $LFS/proc by running the following command. Note that we don't use the $LFS variable because we are now in chroot.
